slides.title: Welcome to Web Development
slides.subtitle: A Journey Through Modern Web Technologies
content: This presentation will guide you through the fundamentals of web development in 2025.
We'll explore front-end, back-end, and the tools that connect them together.

slides.title: HTML - The Structure
slides.subtitle: Building Blocks of the Web
slides.content: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) provides the basic structure of sites, which is enhanced and modified by other technologies like CSS and JavaScript.
bulletPoints: HTML5 is the latest version with new semantic elements
Proper structure improves accessibility and SEO
Semantic HTML helps browsers understand your content
Metadata is crucial for search engine optimization

slides.title: CSS - The Style
slides.subtitle: Making Websites Beautiful
slides.content: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is used to control the presentation, formatting, and layout of a web document.
bulletPoints: CSS3 introduces animations, transitions, and transformations
Flexbox and Grid revolutionized layout design
CSS variables allow for more maintainable code
Responsive design ensures sites work on all devices

slides.title: JavaScript - The Behavior
slides.subtitle: Adding Interactivity to Websites
slides.content: JavaScript is a programming language that allows you to implement complex features on web pages and create dynamic content.
bulletPoints: ES6+ features have made JavaScript more powerful
Async/await simplifies asynchronous programming
DOM manipulation enables interactive web pages
Modern frameworks like React, Vue, and Angular speed up development

slides.title: Front-End Frameworks
slides.subtitle: Building Modern User Interfaces
slides.content: Front-end frameworks provide structure for JavaScript code, make it easier to develop complex features, and help create a consistent design system.
bulletPoints: React - Component-based library with virtual DOM
Vue - Progressive framework focusing on simplicity
Angular - Full-featured MVC framework
Svelte - Compiler-based approach with minimal runtime

slides.title: Back-End Development
slides.subtitle: Server-Side Technologies
slides.content: Back-end development refers to the server side of web development that focuses on how the website works and communicates with databases.
bulletPoints: Node.js - JavaScript runtime for server-side programming
Express - Popular Node.js framework for web applications
Python with Django or Flask for rapid development
Ruby on Rails for convention over configuration

slides.title: Databases
slides.subtitle: Storing and Managing Data
slides.content: Databases are essential for websites that need to store, retrieve, and manage large amounts of data efficiently.
bulletPoints: SQL databases like PostgreSQL, MySQL for relational data
NoSQL options like MongoDB, Firebase for flexible schemas
GraphQL as a query language for APIs
Redis for in-memory data structure store and caching

slides.title: API Development
slides.subtitle: Connecting Applications
slides.content: APIs (Application Programming Interfaces) allow different software applications to communicate with each other.
bulletPoints: REST APIs for standardized communication
GraphQL for flexible data fetching
WebSockets for real-time bidirectional communication
Authentication and security best practices

slides.title: DevOps & Deployment
slides.subtitle: Getting Your Code to Production
slides.content: DevOps practices bridge the gap between development and operations, enabling continuous integration and deployment.
bulletPoints: Git for version control and collaboration
Docker for containerization and consistent environments
CI/CD pipelines for automated testing and deployment
Cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud

slides.title: Web Performance
slides.subtitle: Speed Matters
slides.content: Web performance is crucial for user experience and search engine rankings.
bulletPoints: Core Web Vitals for measuring user experience
Code splitting and lazy loading for faster load times
Image optimization and next-gen formats
Caching strategies for improved performance

slides.title: Accessibility
slides.subtitle: Building for Everyone
slides.content: Web accessibility ensures that websites are usable by people of all abilities and disabilities.
bulletPoints: WCAG guidelines for accessible content
Semantic HTML for screen readers
Keyboard navigation for motor disabilities
Color contrast for visual impairments

slides.title: Security Best Practices
slides.subtitle: Protecting Your Application
slides.content: Web security is essential to protect your application and your users' data from attacks.
bulletPoints: HTTPS for encrypted communication
XSS and CSRF protection
Authentication and authorization
Regular security audits and updates

slides.title: Future Trends
slides.subtitle: What's Next in Web Development
slides.content: The web is constantly evolving with new technologies and approaches.
bulletPoints: Edge computing and serverless architectures
WebAssembly for high-performance applications
AI integration in web applications
Progressive Web Apps (PWAs) for native-like experiences

slides.title: Learning Resources
slides.subtitle: Continue Your Web Development Journey
slides.content: There are many great resources available to help you learn and stay up-to-date with web development.
bulletPoints: MDN Web Docs for comprehensive references
freeCodeCamp for interactive learning
CSS-Tricks for tutorials and techniques
Web dev communities on Discord, Reddit, and Stack Overflow

slides.title: Thank You!
slides.subtitle: Questions and Contact Information
content: Thank you for attending this presentation on web development.
Feel free to reach out if you have any questions or would like to discuss web development further.
